item.title: South Africa’s ANC takes a free market turn
item.description: After years of rolling blackouts, South Africa finally got the lights back on, after the free market-averse ANC decided to take a chance on private enterprise.

item.title: The unlucky truth about love
item.description: Governments are trying and failing to increase birth rates.

item.title: Progressives for news media regulation
item.description: New York legislation would tell publishers how they can and can’t use artificial intelligence.

item.title: Inventors of capitalism seek to sabotage it
item.description: The Netherlands could soon tax unrealized capital gains at 36 percent.

item.title: Indiana knows better than to subsidize the Bears’ stadium
item.description: The state’s experience with economic development programs shows that less is more.

item.title: Why does the government own golf courses?
item.description: The stand-off between the Trump Administration and the National Links Trust is yet another example of poor federal management of public spaces.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs fall to a principled Supreme Court
item.description: The decision is a triumph for the separation of powers and individual liberty.

item.title: Here’s how to help Gen Z conquer its fear of talking
item.description: Phone addiction and national service, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: Did Biden save unions? Now we have numbers.
item.description: The latest numbers show that when you think of organized labor, think of government employees.

item.title: To win in Ukraine, Europe needs nuclear weapons. No, the other kind.
item.description: Deterring Russia, collecting motherly advice and sending postmortem postcards, through readers’ eyes.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg faces the jury — but not the facts
item.description: If Big Tech won’t protect children from the harms of social media, Congress has to step in.

item.title: After Cuba completes its failed-state collapse, then what?
item.description: The Trump-targeted country, low on fuel and low on food, faces, at best, social entropy.

item.title: The sweet scientific vindication of ‘I told you so’
item.description: A new book tells the stories of scientists “ridiculed, exiled, and imprisoned for being right.”

item.title: The moral squalor stemming from communist conviction
item.description: A new book offers a fresh timely look at Leon Trotsky, perpetrator and victim of Soviet communism.

item.title: I am a Catholic. And a Zionist.
item.description: Carrie Prejean Boller and Candace Owens are wrong. Catholics can be Zionists.

item.title: Cartoon by Dana Summers
item.description: Dana Summers cartoon on the waste in the Potomac and Congress.

item.title: New Yorkers will pay for this
item.description: Instead of making government work, Mamdani plans to tax and spend his way to affordability.
